briefTitle: A Study to Evaluate an Updated Dexamethasone Intravitreal (Into the Eye) Applicator in Adult Participants With Macular Edema Due to Diseases of the Retina

armGroups.label: Updated Dexamethasone Posterior Segment Drug Delivery System (DEX PS DDS) 0.7 mg
interventionNames: Device: Updated DEX PS DDS Applicator

armGroups.label: Approved DEX PS DDS 0.7 mg
interventionNames: Device: Approved DEX PS DDS Applicator

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

\- Participants with macular edema due to retinal vein occlusion (branch retinal vein occlusion or central retinal vein occlusion) or diabetic macular edema.

Exclusion Criteria:

\- Participants with ocular conditions in the study eye for which Dexamethasone Posterior Segment Drug Delivery System Implant is contraindicated.

outcomeMeasures.title: Number of Participants Experiencing at Least One Adverse Events (AEs)
outcomeMeasures.description: An adverse event (AE) is defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a participant or clinical investigation participant administered a pharmaceutical product which does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. The investigator assesses the relationship of each event to the use of study.

outcomeMeasures.title: Dexamethasone Posterior Segment Drug Delivery System (DEX PS DDS) Updated Applicator Performance
outcomeMeasures.description: The investigator evaluated whether the updated DEX PS DDS Applicator dispensed the DEX PS DDS implant in the vitreous cavity and performed as intended, using a treatment administration assessment form.
